name: Syllogism Reasoning
description: This task involves providing a series of syllogisms to the model to evaluate its logical reasoning capabilities.

examples.input: All men are mortal. Socrates is a man. What can we conclude?
examples.output: Socrates is mortal.

examples.input: No social media platforms are completely private. Instagram is a social media platform. What can we conclude?
examples.output: Instagram is not completely private.

examples.input: All smartphones are internet-capable devices. Some handheld gadgets are smartphones. What can we conclude?
examples.output: Some handheld gadgets are internet-capable devices.

examples.input: No fast-food meals are nutritionally balanced. Some popular lunches are fast-food meals. What can we conclude?
examples.output: Some popular lunches are not nutritionally balanced.

examples.input: No renewable energy sources produce greenhouse gases. Coal power plants produce greenhouse gases. What can we conclude?
examples.output: Coal power plants are not renewable energy sources.

examples.input: All solar panels convert sunlight to electricity. No wind turbines convert sunlight to electricity. What can we conclude?
examples.output: No wind turbines are solar panels.

examples.input: No organic foods contain artificial preservatives. Some popular snacks contain artificial preservatives. What can we conclude?
examples.output: Some popular snacks are not organic foods.

examples.input: All college graduates have a degree. Some job applicants do not have a degree. What can we conclude?
examples.output: Some job applicants are not college graduates.

examples.input: All hybrid cars are fuel-efficient. All hybrid cars have electric motors. What can we conclude?
examples.output: Some vehicles with electric motors are fuel-efficient.

examples.input: Some online courses are free. All online courses are accessible from home. What can we conclude?
examples.output: Some courses accessible from home are free.

examples.input: All smartphones have touchscreens. Some smartphones are budget-friendly. What can we conclude?
examples.output: Some budget-friendly devices have touchscreens.

examples.input: No fossil fuels are sustainable energy sources. All fossil fuels are carbon-emitting. What can we conclude?
examples.output: Some carbon-emitting energy sources are not sustainable.

examples.input: Some best-selling books are not fiction. All best-selling books are widely read. What can we conclude?
examples.output: Some widely read books are not fiction.

examples.input: No single-use plastics are environmentally friendly. Some packaging materials are single-use plastics. What can we conclude?
examples.output: Some packaging materials are not environmentally friendly.

examples.input: All electric vehicles have rechargeable batteries. No gasoline-powered cars have rechargeable batteries. What can we conclude?
examples.output: No gasoline-powered cars are electric vehicles.

examples.input: Some renewable energy sources are wind power. All renewable energy sources are environmentally friendly. What can we conclude?
examples.output: Some environmentally friendly energy sources are wind power.

examples.input: No junk foods are nutritious. All potato chips are junk foods. What can we conclude?
examples.output: Some potato chips are not nutritious.

examples.input: No digital currencies are physical coins. All physical coins are tangible assets. What can we conclude?
examples.output: Some tangible assets are not digital currencies.

examples.input: All vegetarian dishes are meat-free. No dishes containing beef are meat-free. What can we conclude?
examples.output: No dishes containing beef are vegetarian dishes.

examples.input: No violent video games are educational. Some popular games are violent video games. What can we conclude?
examples.output: Some popular games are not educational.

examples.input: All smartphones are portable devices. All portable devices are battery-powered. What can we conclude?
examples.output: Some battery-powered items are smartphones.

examples.input: All electric cars are zero-emission vehicles. No diesel engines are zero-emission vehicles. What can we conclude?
examples.output: No diesel engines are electric cars.

examples.input: All hummingbirds are nectar-feeding birds. All hummingbirds can hover in mid-air. What can we conclude?
examples.output: Some birds that can hover in mid-air are nectar-feeding birds.

examples.input: No open-source software requires paid licenses. All open-source software is modifiable by users. What can we conclude?
examples.output: Some software that is modifiable by users does not require paid licenses.
